doc:
Larry Parks https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Larry_Parks 0 Samuel Klausman Lawrence Parks (December 13, 1914 – April 13, 1975) was an American stage and movie actor. His career arced from bit player and supporting roles to top billing, before it was virtually ended when he admitted to having once been a member of a Communist Party cell, which led to his blacklisting by all Hollywood studios. His best known role was Al Jolson, whom he portrayed in two films: The Jolson Story (1946) and Jolson Sings Again (1949). Samuel_Klausman_Lawrence_Parks ( December_13_,_1914 – April_13_,_1975 ) was an_American_stage_and_movie_actor . His_career arced from bit_player and supporting roles to top_billing , before it was_virtually_ended when he admitted to having_once_been a_member of a_Communist_Party_cell , which led to his_blacklisting by all_Hollywood_studios . His_best_known_role was Al_Jolson , whom he portrayed in two_films : The_Jolson_Story_(_1946_) and Jolson_Sings_Again_(_1949_) .
